title: Developing Back-End apps with Node.js and Express, IBM
description: Create server-side applications using the Node.js JavaScript run time. Extending Node.js applications with third-party packages and frameworks, including Express. Use npm to manage Node.js packages in Node.js application. Develop asynchronous callback functions and promises to complete asynchronous operations.

title: Developing Front-End apps with React, IBM
description: Develop interactive user interfaces (UIs) and web applications using JavaScript technologies including React, JSX, and ES6.
Build dynamic front-end applications quickly and easily with reusable React components
Employ various React concepts and features, including props, states, hooks, forms, and Redux.
Use React Router to navigate through the application and manage browser history.

title: Learn JavaScript, Scrimba
description: Learned the basics of the JavaScript programming language, like variables, data types, functions, loops, conditionals, and more.
Learned how to use JavaScript to build real-world web apps
Explored how to use professional software development tools for coding, collaboration, and deployment

title: Crash Course on Python, Google
description: Understand what Python is and why Python is relevant to automation
Write short Python scripts to perform automated actions
Understand how to use the basic Python structures: strings, lists, and dictionaries
Create your own Python objects

title: Agile Software Development, Chegg Inc.
description: Learned the principles and practices of Agile software development.
Understand the Agile software development lifecycle.
Learned how to estimate and plan Agile projects.
Learned how to build and manage an Agile team.

title: Java Programming, Great Learning
description: Learned the basics of Java programming language.
Understand the Object-Oriented Programming concepts in Java.
Learned how to use Java to build real-world applications.
Explored how to use professional software development tools for coding, collaboration, and deployment.

title: Java(Basic), HackerRank
description: Completed assessment test of Java programming language.

title: Node and Express Essentials Badge, IBM
description: Showcased the skills of creating server-side applications using the Node.js JavaScript run time.
Explored the concepts of extending Node.js applications with third-party packages and frameworks, including Express.
Showcased the skills of using npm to manage Node.js packages in Node.js application.
